p: To clarify whether the C or prM protein of Muar is responsible for the high pathogenicity of this strain, the two mutant viruses, C Muar and prM Muar, were produced and the virulence of these mutants in mice was examined (1 × 10 4 PFU/mouse) ( Table 1; Supplementary Fig. S1, Experiment 5). Six out of eight mice inoculated with 5NCM Muar and prM Muar died, and the mortality rates of the two groups were higher than that of C Muar-inoculated mice although no clear statistical significance was observed in the survival rates between C Muar- and 5NCM Muar-inoculated mice groups ( p = 0.021). This indicates that the prM protein of Muar is also associated with the higher virulence of this strain.
